original_title: Sri Lanka to open 24 beach properties for tourism investment
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka will open 24 beach properties around the island nation for tourism investment while establishing some top tourism hotspots, Arundika Fernando, State Minister of Urban Development, Housing and Coastal Conservation said.
“24 coastal areas have been identified as tourist attractions in this country,” he told a media briefing on Friday (21).
“Those tourist areas have also been decided to be given to investors, in order to contribute to the country’s economy,” he said without elaborating on exact locations and the expected investments.

Those coastal zones are to be given to new investors under temporary construction. As in other countries of the world, those zones are to be established with coastal protection precautions, Fernando said.
Sri Lanka is looking at every possible way to generate foreign inflows to the country through several avenues including the revival of the tourism industry.

The minister added that the process to develop Colombo, Ella, Nuwara Eliya, Kandy and Trincomalee as tourist hotspots are also underway, some of which involve both the Urban Development Authority and Asian Development Bank in its implementation.
Sri Lanka has attracted over 729,000 tourists as of July 23, and the arrivals more than doubled to 624,874 in the first half of the year, compared to the same period in 2022.
Revenue from tourism jumped 45.1 percent in the first six months to $986.2 million in the first six months of this year. (Colombo/July 24/2023)
